title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in D#

# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in D#

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played or sung in sequence, rather than simultaneously. The Minor 7th arpeggio in D# consists of the notes D#-F#-A#-C#.

## Notes and Intervals
1. **D# (Root)**
2. **F# (Minor 3rd)**
3. **A# (Perfect 5th)**
4. **C# (Minor 7th)**

## Musical Flavor
The Minor 7th arpeggio in D# has a soulful and jazzy sound to it. It adds a melancholic yet sophisticated flavor to music when incorporated into compositions. This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, blues, R&B, and funk genres to create smooth and mellow musical passages.

## Songs Using Minor 7th Arpeggio in D#
1. **"Autumn Leaves"** - This jazz standard makes extensive use of D# Minor 7th arpeggios in various sections of the song.
2. **"Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers** - The guitar riff in the intro of this soulful classic features the D# Minor 7th arpeggio prominently.
3. **"Red House" by Jimi Hendrix** - In this blues-rock anthem, Jimi Hendrix showcases the D# Minor 7th arpeggio in his iconic guitar solos.
